snippet: In a remarkable economic comeback, La Ciotat has become Europe’s largest yacht-maintenance and refitting seaport.
abstract: Port town of La Ciotat, France, has emerged as the world's premiere destination for repairing and maintaining superyachts; town was shipbuilding center since the early 1800s, but declined amid competition following World War II; shift to rarefied maintenance industry has allowed it to mount a stunning economic comeback.
lead_paragraph: In a remarkable economic comeback, La Ciotat has become Europe’s largest yacht-maintenance and refitting seaport.
